title: Day 402
content:
# Day 402

James has an interesting thesis about wether or not the U.S will remain a global reserve currency.

![](https://miro.medium.com/1*UeuBnl7Na8b7qSbZLFsNog.png)

<iframe src="https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2FVsBb4gREvqk%3Ffeature%3Doembed&display_name=YouTube&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DVsBb4gREvqk&image=https%3A%2F%2Fi.ytimg.com%2Fvi%2FVsBb4gREvqk%2Fhqdefault.jpg&key=a19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07&type=text%2Fhtml&schema=youtube" title="" height="480" width="854"></iframe>

Not sure I agree 100% with his thesis. I think hyperbitcoinization should be taking up 3 sqaures and the only way the US keeps global reserve currency status is if they start backing dollars with Bitcoin. That said, who the hell knows. Yesterday I walked with my partner and our neighbor who also has a small child. Our neighbor brought up Bitcoin and I got excited and started to explain it to her. Of course she was kind while I got over excited and my partner rolled her eyes. Maybe I was not explaining it will but my neighbor seemed a bit confused why I could be so passionate about this magici internet money. I pointed out that fiat is infinite and bitcoin is fixed and I don't think she understood what I meany by fiat. After explaining fiat is our current form of money, like US dollars she got my point. It was a great reminder about what an echo chamber I'm in. In a way we are all in our own echo chambers. Got to consider as many sides as possible.

Here are some interesting tweets.

I love how tweets show up on Medium. I know posting a bunch of tweets for my daily post is not really writing, but yolo. I'm curating. Call me the curatooooor.
